killings.description: An unarmed David Werblow died after Branford police shot him with a Taser when he refused to get out of a parked car. Police said Werblow was being uncooperative and had previously attempted to stop cars and enter those vehicles as they passed him walking along Burban Drive in Branford. Police said they initially responded to a call of a disturbance at Werblow's residence.

killings.name: Troy Ray Boyd
killings.description: A sheriff and deputy reported that they were called by a witness to a bloody man riding a 4-wheeler with a machete. When the officers tried to stop Ray, they reported that he tried to run the deputy over, and the deputy shot him to death.

killings.name: Sheldon Haleck
killings.description: Police responded to a call about a man running erratically down the street in downtown Honolulu. He kept running and officers used pepper spray and an electric gun. Finally, the man tripped and fell, allowing officers to control him. He became unresponsive and died at the hospital.

killings.name: William Dean Poole
killings.description: Officers reported that they responded to a call to a veterans' hotline. Poole said that he was suicidal and not to send help because it "would not end well." When officers arrived he was sitting on his lawnmower, opened fire, and the officers returned fire shooting him to death.

killings.name: Librado Perez-Leon
killings.description: Perez-Leon was struck and killed on his bicycle by a suspect in a stolen Cadillac, fleeing from county deputies in a high-speed chase.

killings.name: Justin Todd Tolkinen
killings.description: Police responded to a call about a man carrying a rifle outside his house. Tolkinen, who has a history of drug use and mental illness refused to come out of his house so the police shit him dead.
killings.location: 411 White Bear Avenue, St. Paul, MN 55106

killings.name: Askari Roberts
killings.description: Roberts who allegedly used meth and cocaine the day before was showing signs of paranoia and thought a gang was coming to kill him. His wife pried his hands away from his son and police arrived and Tasered him two or three times until he became unresponsive and died at the hospital.

killings.name: David P. Watford
killings.description: A trooper reported that they hit Watford with their vehicle while Watford, a truck driver, was walking on a dark highway.

killings.name: Declan Owen
killings.agency_responsible: Bladen County Sheriff's Office and the Bladenboro Police Department
killings.description: Officers responded to a report of a man near the high school lying in a ditch with a gun. He caught a ride with a stranger and fled into the woods. officers found Owen lying down with his back on the ground and his head propped up against a tree, he was reportedly facing the road. He allegedly pointed the gun at them and the officers fired, killing the subject.

killings.name: Roberto Jose Leon
killings.agency_responsible: California Highway Patrol, Sacramento Sheriff's Office, Sacramento Police Department, Sacramento Sheriff's SWAT
killings.description: A CHP officer attempted to stop a motorcycle. The driver fled and carjacked a Bronco. Officers hit him with several shots, and Leon barricaded himself in his home refusing to surrender. He bled to death from his wounds.

killings.name: Andrew Charles Shipley
killings.description: Officers were in a standoff after 2 welfare calls to the house of Shipley who was thought to have weapons and to be in the process of being evicted by his girlfriend. Officers reported that Shipley opened the garage and fired at them, and they returned fire killing him.

killings.name: Eugene Frank Smith II
killings.description: Police responded to a call reporting a man at a gas station with a shotgun. When they arrived, there was a firefight, and the man was killed.

killings.name: Alice Brown
killings.description: Plainclothes officers reported that they suspected the car that Brown was in as being stolen, and when they showed her their badges, she fled hitting a gas station building, and other cars along the chase. Officers claimed that she drove the car at them before they shot her to death.
killings.location: Van Ness Ave & Pine St, San Francisco, CA 94109

killings.name: Kaylene Stone
killings.description: Stone was seated in her vehicle when two officers approached her, she displayed a weapon and she refused to comply with officers' commands to drop the weapon and, fearing for their lives, they fired multiple shots, killing her.

killings.name: Garland L. Wingo
killings.description: Officers were called to Lake Ella for a report of a white male armed with a weapon who was reportedly sitting on a park bench. Officer approached and somehow discharged his weapon, killing Wingo.

killings.name: Brandon Rapp
killings.description: Police responded to a domestic disturbance call and were met by a man carrying a gun. Police shot and killed the man.

killings.name: Justin Fowler
killings.description: Officers reported that Fowler was holding his family at gunpoint with an assault rifle, then led police on a chase, at which point he fired on them, killing one officer and was himself shot to death.

killings.name: Robert P. Burdge
killings.agency_responsible: Bakersfield Police Department SWAT, California Highway Patrol SWAT Team
killings.description: Subject involved in a love triangle, shot and killed his rival and barricaded himself in the lobby of the Vagabond Inn. SWAT teams killed him.

killings.name: Kendre Alston
killings.description: Police were chasing a stolen car when the driver wrecked. The two subjects got out and the driver pointed his gun at the officer but didn't fire. They both fled on foot but the officer tracked down the driver and killed him.

killings.name: Jamison Childress
killings.description: It's alleged that Childress was wanted in a murder, and sprayed something into the agent's eyes, and the agent shot him to death.

killings.name: Adam Jovicic
killings.description: An off-duty female officer called 911 because her ex-boyfriend had broken into her home and was beating her, then she shot him to death. Beer bottles were found outside of the house, and investigators are swabbing them for DNA evidence.

killings.name: Brandon Jones
killings.description: Officers reported that they responded to a robbery call at Parkwood Grocery early in the morning when the store was closed. Accounts vary about the time of the shooting. Officers say they had a scuffle with Jones, who had a bag, and they shot him to death. There was no weapon found on Jones.

killings.name: Shane Watkins
killings.description: Subject was having a schizophrenic episode and called police to say his mother was going to kill him. He grabbed a box cutter and went to meet the deputies outside. He allegedly charged at them, refusing to stop and was killed.

killings.name: Richard White
killings.description: Subject allegedly chased a TSA agent with a machete and was shot by police.

killings.name: Frank Viggiano
killings.address: Arthur Kill Rd & W Shore Expy
killings.description: Several off-duty officers had been out drinking together, and were involved in a head-on collision with a tractor-trailer. Two of the off-duty officers in the smaller vehicle, including Viggiano died.
killings.location: Arthur Kill Rd & W Shore Expy, New York City, NY 10312

killings.name: Tyrel W. Vick
killings.description: Police were looking for subject in the death of his brother and saw him on the hgihway in brother's truck. A chase ensued. Subject shot at police. Police shot back, killing subject.

killings.name: James J. Ellis
killings.description: Police responded to a call about a man shooting a gun in the town of Shelby. Subject fled at high speed and crashed into a telephone pole. He then went into the woods and tried to shoot the police.

killings.name: Philip Conley
killings.description: Man with a fake gun in his waistband commits suicide by cop wielding knife in parking lot. Left note for his loved ones.

killings.name: Enoch Gaver
killings.description: Police responded to an assault on a female at Walmart and were greeted by a group of people who allegedly attacked them. Gaver was shot and killed in the melee. Family allegedly lived on the lot and were a Christian band.

killings.name: Romeo Roddrick Staples
killings.address: St. Johns Ave & N. Palm Ave
killings.description: Pursued by police at high speed in a stolen Nissan Pathfinder, and wearing gloves and a handkerchief over his face at the time, Staples' vehicle crossed the center line and crashed head-on into a black Mercedes, killing him and injuring his passenger.
killings.location: St. Johns Ave & N. Palm Ave, Palatka, FL

killings.name: Jason L. Smith
killings.description: Man was making threats to his family. He returned when the police arrived and struggled with an officer who shot and killed him.

killings.name: Gary Page
killings.description: Subject called police and asked them to come shoot him. They found him waving a gun and fired at him, killing him at the scene.

killings.name: James Moore
killings.description: Officers were driving down highway and a man in dark clothing walked into their path and was killed.

killings.name: Devin J. Gates
killings.description: Gates allegedly walked into a 7-11 and tried to rob it at gunpoint. Officers responded in the parking lot, shooting him dead.

killings.name: Jeffrey L. Jackson
killings.description: Police responded to a call of a man trying to flag down traffic on a highway jumping on the hoods of cars. He allegedly fought with police and then stopped breathing at the scene where he was pronounced dead.

killings.name: Denzel Brown
killings.description: Brown was suspected of shoplifting from a Best Buy. Police responded and found him hiding in the parking lot. Subject attempted to open car doors in lot. Tried to steal a car from a couple with children in back seat. Officers shot and killed him.

killings.name: Christopher R. Healy
killings.description: Police called to a home for a burglary and were confronted by the subject with a knife. Officers opened fire and killed the man.

killings.name: Mychael J. Lynch
killings.description: Officers report that they decided Lynch should be moved to another area, but he was uncooperative. They restrained him, and he allegedly suffered an undisclosed medical emergency.

killings.name: Nicholas Thomas
killings.description: Suspect, a mechanic, was at his job when police called his boss and told them they were going to serve a warrant on the suspect. When police arrived the suspect started driving the car he was working on around the business. Police opened fire and killed him.

killings.name: Walter Brown III
killings.description: Suspect was pursued by police to his home where he struggled and was Tasered twice. Police say he pulled a gun and shot him dead.

killings.name: Joseph Tassinari
killings.address: North 67th Ave. and West Peoria Ave.
killings.description: Tassinari, a Vietnam veteran, "showed a gun" to a woman at an ATM machine. She gave his license plates to the police, who showed up at his home and found him in his car. He reached for something in the waistband and was tasered (to little or no effect) and then shot.
killings.location: North 67th Ave. and West Peoria Ave., Glendale, AZ

killings.name: Steven T. Snyder
killings.description: State trooper on his first day out alone on duty thought he recognized man from bank robbery and tried to pull him over. Suspect shot and killed officer whose shots killed him..
killings.location: W Johnson St & US-41, Fond du Lac, WI 54937

killings.name: Scott Dunham
killings.description: It's alleged that Dunham shot and killed an officer from his balcony after two officers responded to a call from Dunham's relative that he was intoxicated, mentally ill, and armed. The accompanying officer who lived then shot Dunham to death.

killings.name: Jeremy L. Kelly
killings.agency_responsible: Johnsonville Police Department; Florence County Sheriff's Office Florence County SWAT
killings.description: Officers respsonded to a call of shots fired, SWAT team called and opened fire when suspect pointed gun at them.

killings.name: Victor Daniel Terrazas
killings.description: Police were investigating the murder of a woman just four block away when they found the suspect armed with a shotgun. Police opened fire killing the suspect.
killings.location: 102nd Street and Vermont Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90044

killings.name: Robert Timothy McAlister Jr
killings.description: Officers reported that McAlister had been involved in an accident, and when confronted he fled in the police cruiser. Later in the chase, McAlister crashed the vehicle and died.
killings.location: Verdae Blvd & Rocky Slope Rd, Greenville, SC

killings.name: Deanne Choate
killings.description: Police responded to a call from boyfriend saying his girlfriend had discharged a gun inside her house. The details are unknown at this point.

killings.name: Adrian Solis
killings.description: Officers responded to a call about a suicidal man with a knife.

killings.name: Harvey E. Oates
killings.description: Police responded to a man with known warrants who was "agitated" and armed. After a 90 minute negotiation, Oates allegedly charged at a cop and was shot dead.
killings.location: Horseshoe Run Road, Fort Ashby, WV 26719

killings.name: Jamalis Hall
killings.description: Task force trying to serve a warrant pulled suspect over. Suspect allegedly reached for a filet knife, and police opened fire.

killings.name: Adrian Hernandez
killings.description: The suspect in a rape and murder, Hernandez set fire to his ex's house and led police on a chase, ending when he got out of his car brandishing a gun.

killings.name: Angelo West
killings.description: Officers of The Youth Violence Strike Force pulled West over and he began firing at them, hitting one cop point blank. They returned fire, killing him.
killings.location: Humboldt Avenue and Ruthven Street, Boston, MA

killings.name: Neil Seifert
killings.description: Officers reported that they responded to a call in which Seifert had attacked his on-again off-again girlfriend. When Seifert shot at the officers, they returned fire and killed him. The location was on Main Street in Webster, Massachusetts.

killings.name: Name withheld by police
killings.address: Shadytree Lane and Glen Arbor Driv
killings.description: Police responded to a 911 hang-up and found a man sitting on his lawn pointing a shotgun at himself. He allegedly pointed it at police and asked them to kill him. They obliged.
killings.location: Shadytree Lane and Glen Arbor Driv, Encinitas, CA 92024

killings.name: Meagan Hockaday
killings.description: Meagan Hockaday, of Oxnard, was pronounced dead at the scene after being shot as she advanced with a knife.

killings.name: Jason Moland
killings.description: An off-duty police officer and a woman were in a park at night, and Moland approached them. There was a confrontation in which Moland pointed a BB gun, and the off-duty police officer shot Moland to death.

killings.name: John Allen
killings.description: Officers reported that they responded to a call about gunshots fired, and when they arrived Allen was outside his apartment and shot at them, at which point they shot him to death.

killings.name: Byron Hebert
killings.description: Police responded to call about a man beating a woman in a supermarket parking lot. On arrival, the man pointed a gun at the officers and was shot dead.

killings.name: Robert Rooker
killings.description: Pike County prosecutors report three deputies were chasing after a man who repeatedly rammed his vehicle into theirs, later shooting and killing him.

killings.name: Ricky Shawatza Hall
killings.description: Officers reported that Hall was driving with another person towards a restricted access gate the National Security Administration, and when she disobeyed orders to leave and sped towards a police cruiser, she was shot to death.
killings.location: 4409 Llewellyn Avenue, Fort George Meade, MD 20755

killings.name: Brian Avon Babb
killings.description: Police haven't released any information except to say he died on his porch.

killings.name: Dominick R. Wise
killings.description: Officer saw Wise acting erratically by walking in circles in the middle of the street. Officer chased and confronted Wise and tased him an undetermined amount of times.

killings.name: Gregory Thomas Joseph Smith
killings.description: While he was being moved from one portion of the jail to another because of alleged violent behavior, correctional officers began restraining him after he displayed more violent behavior. The officers used a dry stun on Smith as the officers tried to restrain him. Two nurses from the jail were called after the officers realized Smith needed medical attention.
killings.location: 2293 N Main St, Crown Point, IN 46307

killings.name: Phillip White
killings.description: White was resisting arrest, and was kicked punched, and bitten by a police dog. At some point after that, he died in police custody.

killings.name: Tyrail Ezell
killings.description: It's alleged that Ezell was shot after after another man driving the car rammed unoccupied police vehicles and swerved in the direction of the officers trying to arrest them during a cocaine peddling investigation.
killings.location: 2333 Rosa L Parks Blvd, Nashville, TN 37228

killings.name: Anthony Stokes
killings.description: Stokes was a robbery suspect and involved in a high speed car chase with police, when he collided with a pole and died.
killings.location: Hembree Road and Highway 9, Roswell, GA 30076

killings.name: Jeremy James Anderson
killings.agency_responsible: U.S. Marshals Service, Tampa Police Department
killings.description: Anderson was wanted on sex-related charges and was deemed a high-risk arrest. Federal and local officers encountered him in a residential back yard, and Anderson was fatally shot after he exchanged fire with them.

killings.name: Benjamin Quezada
killings.description: Benjamin Quezada, 21, was shot and killed by a Baytown police officer early Tuesday after officials said he pointed what appeared to be an AR-15 at the officer. The gun turned out to be a pellet rifle.
killings.location: West Texas and Gaillard Street, Baytown, TX 77520

killings.location: Lark St and Second St, Albany, NY

killings.location: 1900 block N Harvard Ave, Tulsa, OK

killings.agency_responsible: Montgomery County Sheriff's Office, Tomball Police Department

killings.name: Roy D. Barnhart Sr.
killings.description: Officers responded to a multi-party fight in progress. McKinney pepper sprayed and tasered the handcuffed Barnhart and beat him. He died a few days later. McKinney plead guilty involuntary manslaughter.

killings.name: Russell Rios
killings.description: Rios was fatally shot in the back of the head by off-duty officer Sgt. Jason Blackwelder. Officers were detaining Rios outside a Wal-Mart on suspicion of shoplifting when the teen fled into the woods. Blackwelder, who was off-duty, followed him and killed him during an alleged struggle. On September 26, 2013, Blackwelder was indicted on one count of manslaughter, one count of tampering with a government document and one count of false report to a police officer.

killings.name: Montrell Moss
killings.description: Moss was shot by a correctional officer after the 23-year-old threw a cup of water at the officer's car. The officer was convicted of first degree murder.

killings.name: Tony Procell
killings.description: Procell was kidnapped and beaten to death by an off-duty Natchitoches police officer, allegedly as part of a domestic situation. The officer was indicted and is going through trial as of 2014.

killings.name: Mathew Jackson
killings.description: Jackson was shot and killed by an off-duty sheriff's deputy after a minor car collision escalated into shooting. Jackson was unarmed at the time of the shooting. The deputy was indicted for murder in February 2014.
killings.location: 7196 North Loop 1604 E, San Antonio, TX 78216

killings.name: Julie Serna Gonzales
killings.description: An FBI instructor claimed his estranged wife Julie would have killed him with a knife if he had not shot and killed her. Charged with second-degree murder and using a firearm in the commission of a felony. First trial ended in a mistrial.
killings.alleged_crime: V, assault with a deadly weapon (domestic)

killings.name: Jordan West-Morson
killings.description: A scuffle apparently broke out at a gas station where the musician was selling CDs. The off-duty officer shot and killed him, claiming he went for his gun.

killings.name: John Walker
killings.description: Died when an off-duty police officer hit the motorcycle Walker was riding while working as a traffic escort for a funeral.
killings.location: Holly Circle and Airways Boulevard, Memphis, TN 38116

killings.name: William Dupree
killings.description: William Dupree was shot during an altercation in front of Duprees house. The shooting happened when off-duty Pagedale officer James Little came to the house to drop off a child he shares with Duprees fiance. The two men got in an argument, police said, which turned physical. Little then shot Dupree multiple times in the head, according to police. Dupree died at the scene.
killings.location: 2100 block Farrar Avenue, St. Louis, MO 63107

killings.name: David Farries
killings.description: Farries's vehicle was hit by a drunk off-duty police officer traveling over 100 miles per hour, killing Farries. The officer was charged with homicide and is currently standing trial.
killings.location: State Rd & Ashburner St, Philadelphia, PA

killings.name: Susan Macchi
killings.description: Macchi and her daughter were driving home from a baseball game when their vehicle was struck by another car driven by a drunk off-duty state trooper. The trooper, John Basler, was indicted on several charges related to the accident.

killings.name: Juliet Macchi
killings.description: Macchi and her mother were driving home from a baseball game when their vehicle was struck by another car driven by a drunk off-duty state trooper. The trooper, John Basler, was indicted on several charges related to the accident.

killings.name: William Bruce Hemphill
killings.description: In the dawn hours an off-duty officer struck and killed pedestrian Hemphill. He was charged with vehicular manslaughter and DUI.
killings.location: Richmond Terrace and Simonson Ave, Staten Island New York City, NY

killings.name: Kendall Alexander
killings.description: Kendall Alexander was a former police officer married to Crystal Alexander, a St. Martin Parish Sheriff's Office deputy. They had a rocky relationship which included several restraining orders against Kendall. In circumstances that remain unclear, Crystal shot and killed Kendall in their apartment. She was off duty at the time. Crystal no longer works at the Sheriff's Office and was indicted on second-degree murder charge in July, 2014. At this writing, September 2014, she is awaiting trial.
killings.location: 450 East Mills Avenue, Breaux Bridge, LA 70517

killings.name: Keith Jason Martin
killings.description: Martin was shot and killed by a fellow U.S. Border Patrol agent, Adam S. Garibay. Garibay discovered that his wife and Martin had had an affair, assaulted and handcuffed his wife in Corpus Christi, then drove to Hondo to kill Martin. Garibay has been charged with murder.
killings.location: 3 miles north of Hondo, Hondo, TX 78861

killings.name: Natividad Nuez
killings.description: Doa Ana County Sheriff's deputy Eden Terrazas was responding to a call related to a missing child case. She was following a car on Interstate 10, driving 114 mph as she approached the curve in N.M. 192, near Sequoia Road. Terrazas lost control, crossed the opposite traffic lane and hit Natividad Nuez who was walking in the dirt shoulder. She was charged with minor crimes such as driving without a seatbelt.

killings.name: Jesse Sperry
killings.description: An intoxicated off-duty police officer was speeding and rammed the back of Sperry's vehicle, killing Jesse Sperry and injuring the pregnant Rebecca Sperry. The officer was charged with a number of crimes and has been placed on unpaid leave.

killings.name: Justin Griffin
killings.description: Griffin, a basketball coach, allegedly argued with game referee and off-duty Hinds County deputy Joshua Adams. Griffin fought with Adams and a second unnamed off-duty uniformed deputy, who was working security, outside the facility. Parking lot surveillance footage shows blows exchanged and Adams hitting Griffin on the chin. Griffin died the next day. Adams was indicted on manslaughter 07/14.

killings.name: Donna Platz
killings.description: Trooper Frederick Schimp, 48, reportedly failed to stop at an intersection hitting and killing Platz.
killings.location: Sterrettania Road and State Route 98, Fairview, PA 16415

killings.name: Jeffrey Carter McMillan
killings.description: Mobile County Constable Larry Lambert Sheffield was arrested Sunday and charged with murdering McMillan.

killings.name: Jeremey Lake
killings.description: Shannon Kepler, a 24-year veteran of the Tulsa Police Department, shot and killed Lake, his daughter's new boyfriend, in an unprovoked attack at their first meeting. Kepler had recently kicked his 14-year-old daughter out of the house; she had met Lake at a shelter. Kepler was charged with first-degree murder. His wife Gina, also a TPD officer, was charged with accessory after the fact.

killings.name: Vernicia Woodard
killings.description: Woodard was fatally shot multiple times by her former boyfriend, an Atlanta police officer named Tahreem Zeus Rana. After being caught trying to fly to Mexico, Rana faced charges of murder, kidnapping, and a charge of arson for setting Woodard's dead body on fire in an attempt to obscure evidence.

killings.name: Briant Paula
killings.description: A 19-year-veteran of the local police was not only drunk during his head-on collision, unlicensed, with an open container and drunk-driving priors, but witnesses saw him trying to flee the scene, then he provided a false name to an investigator in another department. Paula died in the crash and his sister was seriously injured. The officer was charged with felony motor-vehicle homicide and lesser charges.
killings.location: Riverside Drive and Strathmore Road, Methuen, MA

killings.name: Jeremy Martin
killings.description: Santa Fe County Sheriffs deputy, Tai Chan, and Sheriff's Deputy Jeremy Martin were involved in an altercation in a Las Cruces hotel after visiting several restaurants where they had been drinking.
killings.location: 705 South Telshor Boulevard, Las Cruces, NM 88011

killings.name: Adam Thomas
killings.description: Sheriff's deputies were dispatched on an assault call, but when they pulled up to the home they found the victim suffering from multiple gunshot wounds, Riverside County sheriff's Deputy Patty Stoyer said. The victim, identified as Adam Thomas, 27, of Moreno Valley, was taken to a hospital where he was pronounced dead, Stoyer said. Sheriff's deputies arrested suspect Demery in connection with the shooting. He was booked on suspicion of murder.

killings.name: Keara Crowder
killings.description: Victim was officer's wife. News articles do not specify if officer was on duty at time, though murder weapon is believed to be police issued firearm.

killings.name: Marinan Reese
killings.description: Violent collision with his patrol car and Marinan Reese's car.

killings.name: Joseph Harvey Jr.
killings.description: After road rage on the highway, the off-duty officer and Harvey pulled off the road. As Harvey approached Walker, Walker shot and killed him.

killings.name: Austin Dukette
killings.description: Dukette was riding his bike to school when a deputy hit him with his car, killing him. After a two-month-long investigation, Cape Coral police announced sheriff's Deputy Douglas E. Hood was at fault in the crash that killed the Cape Coral teen. Hood was cited for careless driving. According to a Cape police statement, this concludes the investigation.

killings.name: Dason Peters
killings.address: East 56th Street in the East Flatbush
killings.agency_responsible: Off duty officer City of New York Police Department
killings.description: Off duty police kills 1-year-old child, boyfriend and self.
killings.location: East 56th Street in the East Flatbush, Brooklyn, NY 11203

killings.name: Dylan Samuel-Peters
killings.address: East 56th Street in the East Flatbush
killings.agency_responsible: Off duty officer City of New York Police Department
killings.description: Off duty police kills 1-year-old child, boyfriend and self.
killings.location: East 56th Street in the East Flatbush, Brooklyn, NY 11203

killings.name: Bill Jackson
killings.description: Dwayne Thomas witnessed the first shooting on 10th Avenue. "The man tried to tell Moorer 'It doesn't have to be this way' and put up his hands to try to defend himself, but Moorer opened fire.. bam.. bam.. bam and shot him," said Thomas.

killings.name: Keoshia L. Hill
killings.description: Selma PD says the officer, identified as Dwight Moorer, was off-duty when he shot and killed his ex-girlfriend, 28-year-old Keoshia L. Hill and her step-father, 59-year-old Bill Jackson.

killings.name: Lana Morris
killings.description: Sherlon Smikle, an off-duty NYPD officer fatally blasted his wife, Lana Morris, with a shotgun on their Queens street, then went inside and turned the weapon on himself.

killings.name: Sherlon Smikle
killings.description: Sherlon Smikle, an off-duty NYPD officer fatally blasted his wife, Lana Morris, with a shotgun on their Queens street, then went inside and turned the weapon on himself.

killings.name: Helen Adams
killings.description: Adams was killed about 3 a.m. by an off-duty sheriff's deputy as she crossed a major roadway as a pedestrian. No charges were pressed against the deputy.
killings.location: 6300 block North Federal Highway, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33308

killings.name: Craig Berner
killings.description: Sgt. William McGovern of the Burlington County Prosecutor's Office fatally ran over a motorcyclist and called 911 last July 27. Then, minutes after he learned the victim was off-duty Moorestown Patrolman Craig Berner, McGovern left the scene on Westfield Road to feed a friend's cat, according to law enforcement records.

killings.name: Roza Sakhina
killings.description: Sakhina was struck by a police vehicle while crossing the street, knocking her to the ground and fatally injuring her.
killings.location: 800 Cleveland Ave S, St Paul, MN 55116

killings.name: Justo Quintero
killings.description: Quintero was fatally shot by an off-duty California State University, Los Angeles officer after getting into a confrontation allegedly over the volume of Quintero's music. Quintero was armed at the time of the shooting.
killings.location: 1000 Arroyo Verde Rd, South Pasadena, CA 91030

killings.name: Monica Patterson
killings.description: Patterson was killed as a passenger in a red Taurus when it was struck by a black SUV chased by police. Police were quick to deny any pursuit, which was contrary to accounts of a host of witnesses and home surveillance footage, uncovered by the local CBS affiliate, showing two speeding unmarked police vehicles. The chase began for traffic violations.
killings.location: Southwest 176th Street and 178th Terrace, Miami, FL 33187

killings.name: Maritza Medina
killings.description: Medina died as her Mercedes violently collided with the Mercedes of a fleeing murder suspect, Antonio Feliu, in a high-speed police chase. Feliu killed himself with a pistol after the crash. County deputies and SWAT members set up an hour-long "standoff," filmed by news helicopters, unaware that Feliu was already dead.
killings.location: US Hwy 27 & Griffin Rd, Southwest Ranches, FL 33332

killings.name: Angel Chiwengo
killings.description: Police were slow to reveal the reason why plainclothes officers in an unmarked car chose to pursue Devell Johns and Terrell Young in their Honda Accord. At high speed the Accord slammed into a Jeep with Angel Chiwengo as passenger causing a fiery collision. The driver of the Jeep was seriously injured. Johns, Young and Chiwengo were killed.
killings.location: York Road and Northern Parkway, Baltimore, MD 21212

killings.name: Michael Bryan Barnes
killings.description: Barnes was hit and killed by a patrol car while the 49-year-old was walking across a highway. A District Attorney investigation cleared the officer of any wrongdoing.

killings.name: Andrew Scott Hoffman
killings.description: Hoffman and Hartman were murdered by officer Robinson who committed suicide after he killed the two victims.

killings.name: Marie Leanne Edith Hartman
killings.description: Hoffman and Hartman were murdered by officer Robinson who committed suicide after he killed the two victims.

killings.name: Maria Martinez
killings.description: Police claim to have suspended their 2 a.m. 70-MPH pursuit of a grey van on city street only two minutes before the driver ran a stop sign and slammed into the car of uninvolved motorist, Martinez, killing her.
killings.location: W 24th Street N and Arkansas, Wichita, KS 67204

killings.name: Elizabeth Arellano Renteria
killings.description: Elizabeth Arellano Renteria and Hilda Medrano, both 21, were turning into a McDonald's off State Road 70 when an Okeechobee County sheriffs deputy hit their vehicle. Florida Highway Patrol investigators found the deputy was driving close to 90 mph at the moment of impact.

killings.name: Hilda Medrano
killings.description: Elizabeth Arellano Renteria and Hilda Medrano, both 21, were turning into a McDonald's off State Road 70 when an Okeechobee County sheriffs deputy hit their vehicle. Florida Highway Patrol investigators found the deputy was driving close to 90 mph at the moment of impact.

killings.name: Milton Olin Jr
killings.description: Olin, a former Napster executive and well-known entertainment attorney, was biking along Mulholland Highway when a Los Angeles County sheriff's deputy, who was texting another officer, struck him from behind with his patrol car. Olin was pronounced dead on the scene, and the deputy avoided charges due to a California law exempting law enforcement from the prohibition on using cellphones while driving.

killings.name: Krystal Marie Barrows
killings.description: During a drug task force raid on a trailer near Chillicothe, Ohio, police detonated a flash-bang grenade then entered the residence to find Krystal Barrows on a couch with a fatal gunshot wound in the head. The shot came from the rifle of Sgt. Brett McKnight, reportedly unaware his weapon had discharged. McKnight was put on leave. The county police refused to release an incident report, in defiance of rulings from the state supreme court. Barrows had no criminal history and was the mother of three small children.

killings.name: Bill Livezey
killings.description: An off-duty police officer from Malakoff pulled Livezey over after a bout of road rage. Livezey began complaining of heart problems as sheriff's deputies arrived, and later died in a local hospital. The off-duty officer was indicted on several charges, and the trial is ongoing.

killings.name: Shawnice Osborne
killings.address: South Wilmington Avenue and West Greenleaf Boulevard
killings.description: Four people in two vehicles died in the collision of a grey Chevrolet Monte Carlo, driven by Stacy Garcia Gray, and a red sedan being chased by police, containing Shawnice Osborne, Larry Gilmore, and an unidentified third person. For two miles the sedan had fled officers after a shots-fired call and an attempted traffic stop. The crash and resulting fire was so intense that the make and model of the sedan was unclear.
killings.location: South Wilmington Avenue and West Greenleaf Boulevard, Compton, CA 90220

killings.name: Larry Gilmore
killings.address: South Wilmington Avenue and West Greenleaf Boulevard
killings.description: Four people in two vehicles died in the collision of a grey Chevrolet Monte Carlo, driven by Stacy Garcia Gray, and a red sedan being chased by police, containing Shawnice Osborne, Larry Gilmore, and an unidentified third person. For two miles the sedan had fled officers after a shots-fired call and an attempted traffic stop. The crash and resulting fire was so intense that the make and model of the sedan was unclear.
killings.location: South Wilmington Avenue and West Greenleaf Boulevard, Compton, CA 90220

killings.name: Stacy Garcia Gray
killings.address: South Wilmington Avenue and West Greenleaf Boulevard
killings.description: Four people in two vehicles died in the collision of a grey Chevrolet Monte Carlo, driven by Stacy Garcia Gray, and a red sedan being chased by police, containing Shawnice Osborne, Larry Gilmore, and an unidentified third person. For two miles the sedan had fled officers after a shots-fired call and an attempted traffic stop. The crash and resulting fire was so intense that the make and model of the sedan was unclear.
killings.location: South Wilmington Avenue and West Greenleaf Boulevard, Compton, CA 90220

killings.name: Name withheld by police
killings.address: South Wilmington Avenue and West Greenleaf Boulevard
killings.description: Four people in two vehicles died in the collision of a grey Chevrolet Monte Carlo, driven by Stacy Garcia Gray, and a red sedan being chased by police, containing Shawnice Osborne, Larry Gilmore, and an unidentified third person. For two miles the sedan had fled officers after a shots-fired call and an attempted traffic stop. The crash and resulting fire was so intense that the make and model of the sedan was unclear.
killings.location: South Wilmington Avenue and West Greenleaf Boulevard, Compton, CA 90220

killings.name: John Harding
killings.description: Deputy Pearce was speeding when he struck Harding's vehicle, killing Harding.

killings.name: Jeffrey Ragland
killings.agency_responsible: New York City Department of Correction
killings.description: Jeffrey Ragland was fatally shot by a city correction officer after he allegedly had relations with the woman both men had coveted.
killings.location: 227th St. and 108th Ave., Queens Village, NY 11429

killings.name: Haley Boren
killings.description: Borden, who suffered from a number of mental illnesses and depression, shot and killed his wife, two children, mother-in-law and himself.

killings.name: Kelly Boren
killings.description: Borden, who suffered from a number of mental illnesses and depression, shot and killed his wife, two children, mother-in-law and himself.

killings.name: Marie King
killings.description: Borden, who suffered from a number of mental illnesses and depression, shot and killed his wife, two children, mother-in-law and himself.

killings.name: Joshua "Jaden" Boren
killings.description: Borden, who suffered from a number of mental illnesses and depression, shot and killed his wife, two children, mother-in-law and himself.

killings.name: Tom Smith, Jr.
killings.agency_responsible: Bay Area Rapid Transit Police Department
killings.description: During a search of a robbery suspect's apartment, Smith was accidentally shot in the chest by an accompanying police officer. No criminal charges were toward by the firing office.

killings.name: Harold Powers
killings.description: Powers attempted to kill off-duty deputy Eubanks. Eubanks fired his weapon in self-defense, killing Powers.

killings.name: Christopher Stirkens
killings.description: Christopher Stirkens, 25, lived with his mother and father, Denise and James Stirkens. James, a 27-year police veteran, was off-duty at home when he heard Christopher arguing with his mother. James went to investigate, and found Christopher stabbing his mother. James shot his son with his service handgun, killing him. Denise died later in the hospital. No charges have been filed against James Stirkens.

killings.name: Mark Garcia
killings.description: An off-duty Chicago police officer fatally shot a robbery suspect at a Walgreens store. The officer walked into the store to use the ATM machine. The officer became suspicious when he saw a female employee frantically stashing money in a bag behind the counter while a large man stood in front of the register. The officer walked toward the man, identified himself as an officer and asked the man to get down. There was a struggle, and the officer discharged his weapon. Police recovered a semi-automatic handgun from the scene.

killings.name: Don Pooley
killings.description: Police were initially called to the neighborhood on a domestic disturbance call. When police arrived, Pooley fled the house, ran into another home and took a 13-year-old hostage. The situation was resolved when Pooley went to the front door to retrieve some items. The SWAT team shot him.
killings.location: West 62nd Avenue and Gray Street, Arvada, CO 80003

killings.name: Keith Walker
killings.description: After robbing a bank with a gun, Walker was stopped by an off-duty officer working as private security. Walker was shot and killed when he turned on the officer, gun in hand.

killings.name: Leroy Turner
killings.description: An off-duty police officer shot and killed a burglary suspect at an upscale apartment complex. The University of Texas police officer was working security at the Arcadian Apartments when he responded to a call about a possible break-in. The officer found the door of apartment 731 kicked in. He went inside and confronted an apparent burglar. The suspect immediately charged him. As the two men fought,the officer managed to break free. He pulled his gun and fired. The suspect was pronounced dead at the scene.

killings.name: Jazzman Vontrazc Jacobs
killings.description: Police attempted to pull over Michael Walker Jr. on suspicion of impaired driving. Walker refused to pull over and led a high-speed pursuit for several miles before he lost control of his 2005 Ultima. One of his passengers, Jazzman Jacobs, also died in the crash.
killings.location: U.S. 70 and Interstate 85 Business, Efland, NC 27243

killings.name: Graciela E. Olivas
killings.description: Olivas was killed by a speeding and reckless suspect being chased by local police. The department refused to provide news media a copy of their chase protocols and policies despite repeated similar incidents.
killings.location: 34th Street and Shawnee Drive, Kansas City, KS 66106

killings.name: Graciela E. Olivas
killings.description: Olivas was killed by a speeding and reckless suspect being chased by local police. The department refused to provide news media a copy of their chase protocols and policies despite repeated similar incidents.
killings.location: 34th Street and Shawnee Drive, Kansas City, KS 66106

killings.name: Oscar Gaspar
killings.description: Off-duty officer witnessed two suspects beating a pedestrian outside of a convenience store. Officer told them to stop and was approached by one suspect who apparently brandished a gun. Officer fired from his truck.
killings.location: 700 West Gulf Bank Road, Houston, TX 77088

killings.name: Vanessa Pitofsky
killings.description: Police say Sgt. Nick Pitofsky, a Crandall police officer is said to be the only suspect in the apparent murder-suicide.

killings.name: Marquise Jones
killings.description: Jones was the passenger in a car involved in a minor accident in a drive-through restaurant, exited the vehicle, and attempted to run away. An off-duty but uniformed SAPD officer working security shot him in the back on the claim that Jones had a weapon. Many witnesses dispute the officer's account.
killings.location: 8614 Perrin Beitel Road, San Antonio, TX 78217

killings.name: Maria McEwen
killings.description: McEwen was hit by a Florida Highway Patrol vehicle as the trooper was pulling into a parking lot. McEwen died the next day in a nearby hospital.
killings.location: 2679 N Atlantic Ave, Daytona Beach, FL 32118

killings.name: Name withheld by police
killings.description: An off-duty Houston Police officer awoke to find three men breaking into his house, and began firing toward them and then chasing the three. One of the burglars pointed a handgun at the officer, causing the officer to fatally shoot the man.

killings.name: JoAnna Miller
killings.description: Miller's husband accidentally shot her in the head when he was cleaning his gun. She was 22 weeks pregnant, and the child died after an emergency c-section. The killing was ruled accidental.

killings.name: Name withheld by police
killings.description: An off-duty Border Patrol agent from California shot and killed an unknown man in a residential area of Detroit after socializing with family members. Remarkably the name of the victim, the circumstances and any justification for the homicide have been withheld from the public without explanation.

killings.name: Brendan K. Wright
killings.description: Wright was causing a violent disturbance outside a man's house in a rural area. The man called a neighbor, who was a detective with the sheriff's department. The detective was off-duty, but put his uniform on and proceeded to the residence. When the detective arrived, Wright immediately began shooting at him with a shotgun. Wright's BAC was over legal driving limit. Spokane Investigative Regional Response team found shooting justified.

killings.name: Sakhar Williye Robinson
killings.description: Wearing a mask and armed with a shotgun, Robinson attempted to rob a Chinese restaurant. An off-duty correctional officer who was dining at the restaurant showed Robinson his badge, but he continued to menace customers. The officer shot Robinson three times, killing him. Sheriff's office cleared officer, investigation pending.

killings.name: Lindsay C. Eldessoky
killings.description: Pedestrian Eldessoky was struck and killed at about 3:30 a.m. by a speeding unmarked county vehicle on a highway. The deputy was on duty, and not charged.

killings.name: Reagan Hartley
killings.agency_responsible: Asheboro Police Department, Randleman Police Department, Guilford County Sheriff's Office
killings.description: Multiple police jurisdictions chased a suspect for thirty minutes, initially for his behavior in a Subway restaurant, then for traffic infractions and speeding away from an attempted traffic stop. At one point local officers pursued the suspect the wrong way down an interstate, to the alarm and incredulity of other officers. The suspect plowed head on at 80 or 90 MPH into Hartley's Volvo, killing her.

killings.name: Stanley "Laransie" Whitman
killings.description: Chief McNeese was on a hunting trip with a friend when he accidentally shot and killed his friend Whitman.

killings.name: Codi Ben Bullard
killings.description: An off-duty police officer fatally shot Bullard after seeing him stabbing another man. Bullard was pronounced dead at the scene, and the officer was honored by the Dallas Police Association for saving the man's life.
killings.alleged_crime: V, assault with a deadly weapon

killings.name: Jefferson Duncan
killings.description: Duncan tasered an off duty officer. When the officer recovered from the shock, Duncan threatened to taser him in the head, but the off duty officer opened fire, shooting Duncan multiple times, killing him.

killings.name: Veronica Rizzo-Acevedo
killings.description: Investigators believe Acevedo, a 25-year veteran of the force, shot his wife before turning the gun on himself.

killings.name: Amber Noelle Smith
killings.description: Off duty Chris Smith got in an argument with his wife Amber Noelle Smith, he then shot and killed her then himself.

killings.name: Jonathan Lee Asuzu
killings.description: Asuzu, a security guard at a strip club, got into an altercation with unarmed Brandon Cephus, another security guard. An off duty officer, also working security, attempted to break up the fight with pepper spray. Asuzu shot and injured Cephus. The officer then shot Asuzu, killing him at the scene.

killings.name: Carola Sauers
killings.description: Sauers was riding as a passenger with her husband when they were hit by a police cruiser coming from the opposite direction. She was killed and her husband was seriously injured. The officer was travelling at high speed with lights and sirens on, but it remains unclear whether he was involved in an actual pursuit. City Council placed officer on unpaid leave until state police complete investigation.

killings.name: Quentin Byrd
killings.description: An on-duty Barnesville officer struck Justin Sullivan and Quentin Byrd as the two were crossing a highway around 1 a.m. The officer was treated for injuries at a nearby hospital.

killings.name: Justin Sullivan
killings.description: An on-duty Barnesville officer struck Justin Sullivan and Quentin Byrd as the two were crossing a highway around 1 a.m. The officer was treated for injuries at a nearby hospital.

killings.name: Juvon Allen
killings.description: Allen was shot after attempting to rob an off-duty officer at gunpoint, who shot the 21-year-old three times in the chest after the officer fought him off. He later died at a nearby hospital.
killings.location: 2300 Rebsamen Park Rd, Little Rock, AR 72202

killings.name: Brandon Ellingson
killings.description: A state trooper handcuffed and arrested Brandon Ellingson for boating while intoxicated. The state trooper handcuffed Ellingson and put the wrong type of life jacket on him. Ellingson drowned in the lake.
killings.location: The Lake of Ozarks, Laurie, MO 65038

killings.name: Jason A. Moore
killings.description: Moore shot and killed his ex-wife and boyfriend at her High School reunion. An off-duty FBI agent shot and killed Moore in response.
killings.location: 1110 N Main St, East Peoria, IL 61611

killings.name: Juan May
killings.description: May was shot by an off-duty police sergeant after the two got in an argument and then a fight in the parking lot of a restaurant. The shooting is still under investigation, but the sergeant has returned to work.

killings.name: Nyocomus Garnett
killings.description: Garnett was robbing a restaurant. An off-duty detective confronted Garnett. Garnett pointed a gun at the detective, prompting him to shoot Garnett.
killings.location: 2700 N Big Spring St, Midland, TX 79705

killings.name: Brian Demarcus West
killings.address: West 3rd Street and North Florida Avenue
killings.description: West jumped from his vehicle during a police chase. The officer tried to evade a collision, hitting West in the process. West died from his injuries.
killings.location: West 3rd Street and North Florida Avenue, Lakeland, FL 33805

killings.name: Jacqueline Nichols
killings.address: North Street and East Pierson Road
killings.description: An officer was in pursuit of a suspect when he ran a stop sign and collided with Nichols' vehicle, killing Nichols.
killings.location: North Street and East Pierson Road, Flint, MI 48505

killings.name: Richard Arruda
killings.description: Shotwell was off duty, assisting a woman in a domestic dispute. Arruda, the woman's boy friend, shot at Shotwell as a result. Shotwell then shot and killed Arruda.
killings.location: 535 N Andrews Ave, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33301

killings.name: Geneva M. Scott
killings.description: A state trooper was responding to an accident when he collided with the Scotts vehicle, killing both Norman L. Scott, 78, and his wife, Geneva M. Scott, 79.

killings.name: Norman L. Scott
killings.description: A state trooper was responding to an accident when he collided with the Scotts vehicle, killing both Norman L. Scott, 78, and his wife, Geneva M. Scott, 79.

killings.name: Luis Monroig
killings.description: Amy E. Young, 40, and Luis Monroig, 37 two officers, living with each other and dating. They got into a domestic dispute and shot each other. Monroig died from his injuries.

killings.name: Charles K. Goodridge
killings.description: Off-duty deputy constable Francisco Ruiz was working security for his apartment complex and encountered Goodridge, unarmed and allegedly trespassing the property on which he had lived for nine years until recently evicted. Ruiz says he attempted to arrest Goodridge. Witness David Hall says that Goodridge pushed Ruiz away. The deputy says he chased him and there was a scuffle. He then shot Goodridge twice in the stomach. Ruiz suffered either scratches on his back, a back injury or a concussion. The District Attorney's Civil Rights Division is currently investigating.

killings.name: Misty Holt-Singh
killings.description: Hostage from a bank robbery shot by police
killings.location: Thornton Road and Otto Drive, Stockton, CA 95209

killings.name: Paul Burkons
killings.description: Burkons was lying naked in the street (looking for a reportedly naked man) when the officers accidentally ran him over - killing him.
killings.location: Adams Boulevard and Buckingham Road, Los Angeles, CA 90016

killings.name: Steven Isby
killings.description: Cop returning home from shift very late at night (off duty at the time of the shooting) and sees man in nearby construction. Officer approaches man, identifies himself as a police officer, sees something in the hand of the man, which turned out to be a screw driver. Officer fired several shots (the officer shot himself first before shooting the victim). The victim turned out to be homeless.
killings.location: Marshfield Avenue and Wabansia Avenue, Chicago, IL 60622

killings.name: Frank Mendoza
killings.description: Ramirez took Mendoza's wife hostage. Mendoza engaged in a gun fight with with Ramirez. SWAT accidentally shot and killed Mednoza and also shot and killed Ramirez.

killings.name: Justin Wayne Higgins
killings.address: Aberdeen Circle and Brooken Hill Drive
killings.description: Higgins was car jacking a friend of an off duty deputy. Higgins had a gun pointed to her head, the deputy shot and killed Higgins.
killings.location: Aberdeen Circle and Brooken Hill Drive, Fort Smith, AR 72908

killings.name: James B. DeVito
killings.description: DeVito was the blameless victim of a head-on auto crash with an eight-year veteran of the NYPD, driving full-speed southbound in the northbound lanes of the state Thruway. The officer also died. Contrary to initial police reports, the officer had a blood-alcohol level of 0.21 percent at 7 a.m. and on his way to work.
killings.location: Interstate 87 and North Airmont Road, Suffern, NY 10901

killings.name: Morgan Lee
killings.description: Student Lee was killed in a head-on collision with a marked local police vehicle. A police investigation held that the vehicles were traveling in opposite directions and both had a green traffic signal. Lee's parents filed a wrongful death suit against the city.

killings.name: Travis Donald Wegener
killings.description: Little, a police cadet, opened fire at the home of his former girlfriend, first shooting her 47-year-old mother and family friend Wegener in the driveway, then shooting the girlfriend. Wegener died, the mother seriously wounded, the girlfriend wounded in the leg. In turn the cadet was shot and killed at the scene by the girlfriend's brother.

killings.name: Maria Fernanda Godinez
killings.description: Orlando police said the woman who was shot and killed in a club in downtown Orlando was struck by a stray bullet from an officer's gun.

killings.name: Sergio Ramos
killings.description: Ramos attempted to rob an acquaintance at a gas station, then shot and killed him. An off-duty local officer just finishing up a private security shift at the adjacent Wal-Mart approached Ramos, saw his handgun, and fatally shot him as Ramos went for the weapon.

killings.name: Larry Collins
killings.description: Brian Lipp was engaged in a car chase with police and was a suspect in a robbery that occured earlier. Larry Collins was killed by Toledo police when they pursued Lipp the wrong way up I-75.

killings.name: Bien Cam Tran
killings.description: Bien Cam Tran was in a crosswalk walking northbound across East 12th Street at Third Avenue about 1:30 p.m. Aug. 30 when he was hit by a black-and-white Ford Crown Victoria driven by OfficerDevin Underwood
killings.location: East 12th Street at Third Avenue, Oakland, CA 94606

killings.name: Thomas Davis
killings.description: An officer was driving on Enterprise Avenue hit Davis with his vehicle. It was dark, the street was poorly lit, and Davis was reportedly in the traffic lane.

killings.name: Fredi Morales
killings.description: A Wheeling officer was speeding to catch up to a traffic violator. The officer had not activated his sirens yet, when he accidentally struck Morales with the squad car.

killings.name: Nancy Joyce Garrett
killings.description: Deputy Nicholas Clerico was responding to a call and driving with lights and sirens when his vehicle struck Garret's. She died from her injuries. Her son Mark McGowan retained a law firm. As of 10/07/14, the family is considering filing a lawsuit.

killings.name: Rafael Laureano
killings.description: Rafael Laureano died when he was hit by a bullet from police officers who were firing at Francisco Carvajal who had attacked Laureano and his girlfriend with a knife.

killings.name: VonDerrit D. Myers Jr.
killings.description: Officer Jason Flanery was off-duty but in uniform on neighborhood patrol for a private security company. The officer said that Myers ran away from a marked security car, and fired shots at Flanery during a foot chase before the officer fired back. Witnesses dispute this account, saying that VonDerrit was unarmed and a gun was planted at the scene. Myers' DNA was not found on the gun.

killings.name: Ahaviel T. Whitfield
killings.description: An off-duty DeKalb officer was working security at a shopping plaza when an armed man approached a woman from behind and attempted to steal her vehicle, police said. The victim got the attention of the officer, who found Whitfield in the womans vehicle, approached him and ordered him to drop his handgun. Whitfield instead pointed the gun at the officer, and was shot and killed, police said.

killings.name: Michelle D. Sloyan
killings.description: Danny Floyd, 63, and Michelle Sloyan, 49, died from injuries sustained in the crash on Bartlett Boulevard and Stage Road. Floyd was turning at the intersection when Hines' cruiser crashed into him. A witness said the officer had his blue lights on until he sped through the intersection.

killings.name: Danny Floyd
killings.description: Danny Floyd, 63, and Michelle Sloyan, 49, died from injuries sustained in a crash. Floyd was turning at an intersection when Hines' cruiser crashed into him. A witness said the officer had his blue lights on until he sped through the intersection.

killings.name: Richard Hester
killings.description: Hester was killed after an officer hit his vehicle with his car. The officer had his sirens on, but hit Hester as he was turning.

killings.name: Florence White
killings.description: White was crossing the street around 2am when a sheriff struck and killed her with his car.

killings.name: Christopher Mason McCray
killings.address: All American Highway and Cliffdale Road
killings.description: McCray ran into the road on the highway around 8pm and a trooper hit him with his car.
killings.location: All American Highway and Cliffdale Road, Fayetteville, NC 28314

killings.name: Jennifer S. Chauvin
killings.description: A state trooper failed to yield to Chauvin at a stop sign. He hit her car at the intersection. Chauvin died, but trooper and Chauvin's children survived.
killings.location: Telegraph Rd & Chasm Rd, Au Sable, NY

killings.name: Rodrigo Cabral
killings.address: Santa Fe Street and Grove Avenue
killings.description: Rodrigo Cabral, 27, was celebrating Halloween early Saturday morning in Visalia. He was in the middle of the road, according to police, when he was struck by a police car.
killings.location: Santa Fe Street and Grove Avenue, Visalia, CA 93291

killings.name: Aaron Fulton
killings.description: Aaron Fulton, 28, was attempting to cross Ohio 7 near the County House Lane intersection when he was hit by Deputy Brad Holbert. A hypodermic needle was found on Fulton, it is unclear whether he was intoxicated or not.
killings.location: OH-7 & County House Ln, Marietta, OH 45750

killings.name: William Anderson
killings.description: Hartselle police said Lt. James Holladay was on a routine patrol on Sparkman Street when a man crossed the street in front of him. Police said the car ran into the man, killing him.

killings.name: Keith Atkinson Jr.
killings.description: Keith was struck and killed by a police car on New York Avenue as the officer was responding to a report of a suspicious person.

killings.name: Pamela Edwards
killings.agency_responsible: Lake County Sheriffs Office, Eustis Police Department
killings.description: Involved in a hit and run Edwards was followed to Grant Street by an off-duty officer. Edwards then pointed a gun at investigators prompting officers to shoot and kill Edwards.

killings.name: Delbert Rodriguez Gutierrez
killings.description: Delbert Rodriguez Gutierrez, a street artist who goes by the name Demz, died Tuesday night after being struck by an unmarked Miami police car during a chase in Wynwood.
killings.location: NW 5th Ave & NW 24th St, Miami, FL

killings.name: Sandra Simpson
killings.description: A sergeant shot his wife before turning the gun on himself in a murder suicide. Midland Police say Sgt. Simpson most recently worked in the traffic division and had been employed with the department for more than nine years, also serving patrol and K-9 assignments throughout his career.

killings.name: Terrell Beasley
killings.description: As the officer pulled to the curb in the 3800 block of North 25th Street and began to get out of his truck, Irons and Terrell drove alongside and someone in the car shot at the officer. Authorities said the officer returned fire and Terrell Beasley, 28, of the 4000 block of Cleveland Avenue, was killed during the shootout. Beasley's body was found a few hours later in a burning vehicle in the 700 block of Thrush Avenue in the Baden neighborhood. It's unclear whether Terrell was armed or the one who shot the officer.

killings.name: Andrew McIlvain
killings.description: Navy veteran McIlvain was legally riding a "scooter style motorcycle" when he was rear-ended by a speeding local police cruiser, thrown, and seriously injured by the crash. He was taken off life support three weeks after the crash. His family has filed suit.
killings.location: Dunlawton Avenue at Village Trail, Port Orange, FL 32127

killings.name: Khamis Shatara
killings.description: Shatara is the son of the deputy involved and believe the incident was domestic-related
killings.location: 320 Franklin Club Dr, Delray Beach, FL 33483

killings.name: Matthew McCloskey
killings.description: A young boy on his way to a sleepover was struck and killed by a police cruiser while crossing the street with friends in Franklin Township, New Jersey.

killings.name: Craig Schiffer
killings.description: Suffolk County police say that a squad car with two officers aboard was responding to an emergency call on Long Island when it struck a pedestrian who later died.

killings.name: Garrett Gagne
killings.description: An officer was responding to an emergency. The officer ran over a large object, and immediately pulled over. The officer discovered that he'd run over a human body. The victim was fatally wounded. The District Attorney said that Gagne was "seriously impaired" from drugs and alcohol.
killings.location: Crowell Road and Tipcart Drive, Chatham, MA

killings.name: Michael Kocher Jr.
killings.description: Kocher was walking on the roadway at around 9:35 p.m., just east of the Kaumakani Post Office, when he was struck by a Toyota Corolla heading east-bound. The driver stopped and police were called. Thats when a responding officer, also heading east, struck Kocher a second time.

killings.name: Louis F. Becker
killings.description: Becker was turning onto a road when he was struck by a police SUV. He died of his wounds at the hospital.
killings.location: Route 23 and Cairo Junction Road, Catskill, NY 12414

killings.name: Howard "Robert" Robbins
killings.description: Robbins, 69, of Crab Orchard, was walking along KY150 around 9:30 p.m. when a Standford city police cruiser hit him.Troopers said Robbins was wearing dark clothes.

killings.name: Christina Prestianni
killings.description: Authorities said they believe Minichini, a corrections officer, shot his live-in girlfriend, and then himself in an apparent murder-suicide.

killings.name: John Ballard Gorman
killings.description: Gorman was shot during at the Mississippi Gaming Commission office during a training exercise when another agents gun discharged accidentally. The agent involved in the shooting has been suspended with pay during the investigation into the shooting. Gorman had been with the MGC for 22 years and had been promoted to Director of Investigations the day before he was killed.

killings.name: Kevin D. Garrett
killings.description: An unmarked police car hit and killed a man crossing a street without proper streetlights.

killings.name: Dean Joseph Bucheit
killings.description: Bucheit was hit and killed by an officer driving their vehicle. The officer was on the way home early morning during foggy conditions.
killings.location: 13600 Culver Blvd, Marina Del Rey, CA 90292

killings.name: Bernard Moore
killings.address: Metropolitan Parkway SW and Fair Drive SW
killings.description: A deputy on routine patrol hit and killed a man crossing the street. Deputies say the man was more than 100 feet from the nearest crosswalk.
killings.location: Metropolitan Parkway SW and Fair Drive SW, Atlanta, GA 30315

killings.name: Joe Rodriguez
killings.address: Arthur Kill Rd & W Shore Expy
killings.description: Several off-duty officers had been out drinking together, and were involved in a head-on collision with a tractor-trailer. Two of the off-duty officers in the smaller vehicle, including Rodriguez died.
killings.location: Arthur Kill Rd & W Shore Expy, New York City, NY 10312

killings.name: Julian Dawkins
killings.description: Dawkins and an off-duty deputy, Craig Patterson, argued. Patterson got his badge and his gun and attempted to arrest Dawkins, instead, shooting and killing him. Patterson was sentenced to 6 years.

killings.name: David Compton
killings.description: David Compton was shot in the head inside the home of Deptford Officer James Stuart, 29, in what was called at the time a tragic accident. Compton was taken to Cooper Medical Center in Camden, NJ, and died of his wounds. Stuart was charged with first-degree murder, pleaded not guilty, a trial could begin in April 2015.
